page.title: 06FISHING IN THE TEME
page.content: THE BIRMINGHAM ANGLING ASSOCIATION (B.A.A)HAVE THE FISHING RIGHTS ON THE TEME FROM EASTHAM BRIDGE TO EARDISTON MILL.RICHARD CORBETT, FROM TAMWORTH IN ARDEN, IS ONE OF THE 10,000 MEMBERS.HE COMES FISHING TWICE A WEEK.HE LEAVES HOME ABOUT 5.30AM.HE BRINGS WITH HIM ABOUT 3 PINTS OF MAGGOTS AT Â£1.10 A PINT.HE FISHES FOR BARBEL,CHUB,DACE, ROACH AND GREYLING.THE BEST TIME FOR FISHING IS A SUNNY DAY WHEN THE RIVER HAS FLOODED AND THEN BECOME CLEAR.HE ONLY TAKES HOME GREYLING AND IT MUST BE MORE THAN 20CM.A FISHING LICENCE COSTS Â£13 A YEAR FROM THE B.A.A AND HE MUST ALSO HAVE A SEVERN TRENT WATER BOARD LICENCE AT Â£2.50.ON JUNE 16TH,THE 1ST DAY OF THE COARSE FISHING SEASON HE STARTED OUT AT 3.30AM!HE STAYS OUT TILL THE PUBS OPEN.
